Journalists in the West Bank face mounting suppression
description: Since October 7, Israel has arrested and imprisoned at least 140 journalists working in this occupied territory, most often under the catch-all charge of 'incitement to terrorism.' The Palestinian Journalists Syndicate has condemned what it describes as a strategy to 'silence' media professionals.

UNICEF France calls for protecting underage victims of criminal exploitation rather than punishment
description: In a new report, the French branch of the UN agency highlights the lack of resources for identifying and protecting minors who are victims of criminal exploitation. It makes 75 recommendations for public authorities.

description: The Japan Meteorological Agency forecasted waves as high as 3 meters could hit the country's coastal cities.

headline: How France's far right is betting on cryptocurrencies
description: The Rassemblement National is preparing a draft law to 'mine' bitcoin using surplus electricity from nuclear power plants, demonstrating the far right's parliamentary advocacy on the issue.

headline: No progress made on France's terrorism memorial despite years of studies
description: French President Emmanuel Macron reaffirmed his commitment in January to see the site inaugurated after years of back-and-forth in the planning process. But the funding has not been secured.

'In the West Berlin squats, we argued but lived together': Karin Wieland, political rebel
description: 'Being 20 in West Berlin' (2/6). In the late 1970s, Karin Wieland fled her small German town to live communally in an abandoned building in Kreuzberg, throwing herself into every cause of the era.

headline: Suing the state in France: How does this universal right work in practice?
description: Climate, health, femicides: Lawsuits against the state have surged in recent years. Beyond securing compensation for victims, these legal procedures primarily aim to raise public awareness and drive change.

headline: Economist Dmitry Nekrasov: 'Only a handful of sanctions have had a serious effect on Putin's ability to continue the war'
description: Nekrasov, a former Kremlin adviser who joined the opposition and now lives in exile, discusses the EU's latest package of sanctions against Russia and their potential effectiveness.
